glsa.title: Ruby: Arbitrary command execution through XML-RPC
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in XMLRPC.iPIMethods allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands.

background.p: Ruby is an interpreted scripting language for quick and easy object-oriented programming. XML-RPC is a remote procedure call protocol encoded in XML.

description.p: Nobuhiro IMAI reported that an invalid default value in "utils.rb" causes the security protections of the XML-RPC server to fail.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ruby users should upgrade to the latest available version:
